content:
![img-6.jpeg](images/image_5_6.jpeg)
FIGURE 5.4

# Solution

Potential energy of the configuration arises due to the potential energy of one dipole (say,  $\mathbf{Q}$ ) in the magnetic field due to other (P). Use the result that the field due to  $\mathbf{P}$  is given by the expression [Eqs. (5.4) and (5.5)]:
summary: This solution involves understanding that the electrostatic potential energy arises due to the dipole-dipole interaction in magnetic fields and using the equation to describe the energy between two magnetic dipoles.
hypothetical_questions: What is the electrostatic potential energy between two magnetic dipoles?
How are two magnetic dipoles oriented in relation to each other in determining the dipole-dipole interaction in magnetic fields?
